title: Trump threatens 200% tariffs on French wine and champagne after Macron refuses to join 'board of peace'
subhed: 'Tariff threats to influence our foreign policy are unacceptable and ineffective,' a source close to Macron said on Tuesday, after France said it intends to decline the US leader's invitation to join his 'board of peace' to rebuild Gaza.

title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
French PM breaks promise in order to strike budget deal with Socialists
byline: By Mariama Darame and Marie Pouzadoux

title: These French billionaires want to be taxed, but don't say it publicly
subhed: The head of Oxfam France questioned billionaires about the 'Zucman tax,' a wealth tax on households worth more than €100 million. Not all were opposed, but none wanted to make their views public.

title: Probe opened after migrant worker dies in police custody in Paris
subhed: El Hacen Diarra, a 35-year-old Mauritanian man, died inside a police station after a violent arrest. The investigation is seeking 'to determine whether intentional violence by a person holding public authority caused the death.'

title: Philharmonie de Paris director responds to protest at Israeli orchestra performance
subhed: On November 6, 2025, pro-Palestinian activists disrupted an Israel Philharmonic Orchestra concert three times. Olivier Mantei says he refused to equate artists with their government's policies.
byline: Interview by Nathalie Brafman and Laurent Telo

title: In 'Hamnet,' love is haunted by the specter of death
subhed: Chloé Zhao's film, marked by its raw and singular poetry, follows the formation of William Shakespeare's household, capturing both its joys and tragedies.

subhed: The president's threats could undermine the agreement reached by the United States and the European Union in the summer of 2025.

title: The strange airborne rescue of Gaza's donkeys, from Israel to Europe
subhed: Since 2022, Sharon Cohen, who runs an animal rescue group near Tel Aviv, has removed donkeys from Palestinian owners she accuses of mistreatment and sent them to shelters across Europe. The initiative has drawn outrage amid Gaza's deepening humanitarian crisis.

title: Minneapolis emerges as new epicenter of resistance to Trump: 'ICE wasn't expecting that'
subhed: For several weeks, Minnesota's largest metropolitan area has been living under the strain of Operation Metro Surge, which saw the deployment of 2,000 Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers. Since the death of Renee Good on January 7, tensions with residents have reached a peak.
